Project: A Recent Decrease of Oil Production in Syria?
Overview: Analysis of satellite imagery to detect oil production in conflict zones in Syria
Data tool which collects and visualizes data about mining legislation in Africa.
Analysis of oil production in Libya during the internal conflict beginning in 2011
Web portal providing access to data about oil and gas production and water use in Mexico via interactive maps.
Data collection and visualization about the mining industry in the DRC.

Project: Counter-mapping Land Grabs with Community Drones in Indonesia
Overview: Details an effort to document land use using unmanned aerial vehicles (drones) to generate high-quality community controlled maps.
Interactive visualization of revenue data from EITI reports, including commodity disaggregation and company-level data.
Highlights data use stories, offers trainings/tutorials on data tools.
Provides evidence, tools and toolkits for over 40 extractives sector topics from a range of sources.

Project: Fatal Extraction: Where Australian Mining Leaves Its Mark

Overview: Interactive data visualization showing the result of various conditions relating to a oil production contract in Uganda.
Interactive map showing the status and effects of fracking projects around the globe.
Provides spatial boundaries for oil and mining concessions in various countries
Collects satellite imagery of gas flaring to detect and track reductions in gas flaring.
Dynamic visualization of mining fields and projects in DRC.
Access to up-to-date oil and gas production data from over 60 oil-producing countries.

Project: Las Intocables Exoneraciones del Club Minero
Overview: Analysis of the impact of tax exemptions on revenue collection for mining companies in Peru.

Project: Los Silenciados de la Guerra por la Tierra
Overview: Interactive map showing the victims of violence related to environmental justice across South America.
Interactive map showing all aspects of the natural resource chain, from project level production to revenue collection and community investment, across Colombia.
Interactive map tool showing data collected from mining company annual reports. Searchable platform shows parent companies of mines, commodities.

Interactive map tool for comprehensive natural resource monitoring of DRC, including forestry, mining and oil concessions. Additional layers show forest cover, roads, civil projects, and infrastructure. Report feature allows users to author and submit research findings based on use of the tool. Users can also upload their own geospatial data, making it a highly collaborative tool.
Aggregation of various mining cadastres for different countries.

Project: Natural Resource Sector FDI and Growth in Post-Conflict Settings
Overview: Paper examining evidence on the economic impacts of natural resource sector foreign investment in Liberia. The authors use economic data and night-time lights analysis to estimate the economic impact in communities near natural resource concessions and infrastructure.

Interactive map tool showing oil spills reported around Nigeria, including date, magnitude, cause and status. Relies on company and citizen reporting. Additional layers show oil concessions and environmental information, such as soil status and wetland coverage.

Project: Why Weren't Governments Better Prepared for the Commodity Price Crash?
Overview: Blog post with interactive visualization about natural resources revenue and price volatility in various countries.
Interactive map tool showing oil and mining concession data in Tanzania. Links to contracts where available.
Search engine for public domain documents filed by oil & gas and mining companies to financial regulators around the world.
Measures the quality of governance in the oil, gas and mining sectors of 58 countries, based on a set of key governance components.
Repository of publicly available investment contracts for oil, gas and mining projects. Features plain language summaries of key provisions and provides tools for searching and comparing contracts.

Provides a platform to collect and search extractive project information using open data. Aims to harvest data on project payments to governments from financial disclosures and EITI reports, then link to associated information from a variety of government and industry sources.

Interactive map presenting information on citizen and community rights to natural resources in sub-Saharan Africa. Targets five natural resources: water, trees, wildlife, minerals and petroleum and presents answers to a series of standard questions for each.

Project: Secret Offshore Deals Deprive Africa of Billions in Natural Resource Dollars
Overview: Analysis of the Panama papers, showing links between companies incorporated offshore and ongoing investigations into oil and gas companies.

Website which keeps daily track of the amount of barrels of crude and refined oil shipped to various ports of interest around the globe. Relies on maritime tracking data and volume estimates rather than government reports.
Government data portal for access to corporate payments to government reports from corporations listed on UK stock exchanges.

Project: Natural Resource Revenue from Federal Lands
Overview: Data portal for accessing data on production levels and revenue for federal production in the United States.
Provides country dashboards for a variety of extractives data sources.

Part of Open Oil's Financial Modeling Program, a program to to create an open financial modeling community to share tools, skills and experience. Financial models created in Excel forecast future cashflows of a specific project and evaluate how cashflows are shared between governments and investors (companies), based on the applicable fiscal rules.

Financial models created in Excel forecast future cashflows of a specific project and evaluate how cashflows are shared between governments and investors (companies), based on the applicable fiscal rules.

Financial models created in Excel forecast future cashflows of a specific project and evaluate how cashflows are shared between governments and investors (companies), based on the applicable fiscal rules.

Financial models created in Excel forecast future cashflows of a specific project and evaluate how cashflows are shared between governments and investors (companies), based on the applicable fiscal rules.

Interactive map tool combining geospatial, ownership and production datasets from the US Bureau of Ocean Energy Management. Allows user to view the ownership and production levels of lease blocks in the Gulf of Mexico for major leaseholding companies, including ExxonMobil, Shell, and BP.
